skill.name: writing-config-files
skill.description: Use this skill when you need to write configuration files in `src/config` for the Next.js app
skill.summary: Write modular configuration files for Next.js applications following established patterns
skill.author: Emz1998

security_audit.summary: Static analysis flagged markdown backticks as shell command patterns and misidentified YAML content as cryptographic code. Manual review confirms these are false positives. The SKILL.md file contains only YAML frontmatter and markdown documentation with no actual code execution, cryptographic operations, or security risks.

content.value_statement: Create clean, maintainable configuration files for Next.js applications. This skill enforces modular patterns and follows best practices for organizing app settings.
actual_capabilities: Generate new configuration files in src/config directory
Create modular config files with single responsibility
Separate related configs into multiple focused files
limitations: Only writes files in src/config directory
Does not modify existing configuration files
Does not read or analyze existing configs

use_cases.title: Add new app settings
use_cases.description: Create a new configuration file for feature flags, API endpoints, or theme settings

use_cases.title: Organize environment configs
use_cases.description: Create modular environment-based configuration files for different deployment targets

use_cases.title: Standardize team configs
use_cases.description: Generate configuration files that follow team conventions for consistency

prompt_templates.title: Basic config request
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a config file for [describe the configuration purpose] in src/config/[file-name].ts

prompt_templates.title: Feature-specific config
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a modular config file for [feature name] with all related settings. Place it in src/config and keep each config item in its own file.

prompt_templates.title: Type-safe config
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a TypeScript config file for [configuration area] with proper type definitions. Export a single config object and keep file under 50 lines.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-file config
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a config module for [feature] with separate files for each config concern. Each file should contain one function or constant and stay under 50 lines.

output_examples.input: Write a config file for API endpoints
output_examples.output: Created src/config/api.ts containing API endpoint configuration with type-safe constants
Generated src/config/features.ts with feature toggle constants organized by feature area
Created src/config/theme.ts with color tokens, spacing values, and typography settings as type-safe exports

best_practices: Keep each config file focused on a single concern
Use TypeScript types for configuration validation
Export config values as constants or getter functions
Limit file size to under 50 lines for maintainability
anti_patterns: Combining unrelated settings in one file
Using any types instead of proper TypeScript types

faq.question: What directories can this skill write to?
faq.answer: This skill writes configuration files to the src/config directory only.

faq.question: Does this skill modify existing files?
faq.answer: No, this skill only creates new configuration files. It does not modify or delete existing files.

faq.question: What file formats are supported?
faq.answer: The skill creates TypeScript (.ts) files with proper type definitions.

faq.question: How are configuration values validated?
faq.answer: The skill uses TypeScript types to define configuration shapes but does not validate runtime values.

faq.question: Can I create nested config directories?
faq.answer: The skill follows a flat structure in src/config. For nested configurations, consider subdirectories within src/config.

faq.question: Does this skill handle environment variables?
faq.answer: The skill can reference environment variables in config files but does not read or validate them directly.
